args:
Cleo reveals that she cared for Lathna because
she once chose solitude herself, teaching her
the sting of loneliness. Affirmed by Cleo, Lathna
opens her heart and decides to work with her to
resolve the case.
I'm a bad girl. I'm the evil Nyarlathotep\nwho torments everyone.
That's why I'm going to go somewhere\nalone. Someplace no one else knows.\nI don't want to be a burden anymore.
It's okay. Just leave me.\nThank you for everything...and goodbye.
No! I won't let you go!
...Huh? Cleo? Why are youâ€”?\nStop! Let me go!
I won't. I can't let you be by yourself.\nNot while you're in such obvious pain.
I told you at the start, didn't I? I wanted\nto see you smile, so I took you out of my\nown volition.
...I don't know. I just don't know. Why\nare you trying so hard to care for me?
Because you're the same as I was,\nlong ago.
Huh? What... What do you mean?
I, too, once thought myself unworthy, and\nso I sought out solitude of my own accord.\nI was just like you.
I know how you must be hurting.\nAnd I refuse to let you suffer.\nSay... Can I tell you something, Lathna?
Long ago, I too ended up killing someone.

Long, long ago, in spite of my parents' opposition,
I left my hometown and started working in the far-
flung Halidom. Back then, the Halidom stood at the
front line of the war. My parents sent letter after
letter urging me to come home.
But I, possessed of a rebellious streak, sent only\nperfunctory replies to humor them. And in the end,\nthat callous attitude led to the death of my parents.

Fearing for my safety, my parents left the forest to
try and bring me back to my hometown. They...died
on the way out. It was like I'd killed them myself.
Lost in despair, I shut myself in my room.
I thought I'd lost the right to interact with people.\n\nBut...she wouldn't leave me on my own.
Hello, Cleo. I brought you something to\neat. I wondered if you wouldn't let me\nspeak to you for a little while.
Myriam. I told you before, didn't I?\nPlease don't involve yourself with me.
If you truly, in your heart of hearts,\nwanted to be alone, I would leave you be.\nBut something tells me that's not the truth.
You can't fool me. Your loneliness is\nwritten all over your face. So please...\nLet me be there for you.
No. I'll only be a bother to you.\nI killed my parents. I have no right\nto have anyone at my side.
This is how I should be. Alone.
You don't need a ï¼‚rightï¼‚ to have a friend in\nyour corner. And furthermore, I chose to\ncome here of my own volition.
No matter what you did, you would never\nbe a bother to me.
I wish I could believe you.\nBut...I can't. Not right now.
That's fine. For now, just let me stay by\nyour side and hold your hand like this.
And until the day when you regain the\nstrength to stand strong once more,\nI will never let you be alone.
She was like an older sister to me.\nEven though I was curt, she never strayed\nfrom my sideâ€”never broke her promise.
Whenever I insisted I'd be fine alone,\nshe fired back that I was wrong.
You're just like me.\nI said those same kinds of things to you...
That's right. I'm just like you.\nI bottled everything up and refused\nto subject anyone else to my burdens.
But before I realized it, my frozen heart\nhad begun to thaw...all thanks to her.
And that's why, if you're mired in the same\nsort of self-hate, trapped in the same pit of\nloneliness I fell into back then...
I want to stay with you until you learn\nto accept the love you deserve.\nJust like she did for me.
I'm not leaving your side until you stop\nlying to yourself and stop insisting you're\nfine being alone!
You're... You're right, Cleo.\nI finally get it.
I was lying to myself. Saying I'd be fine,\npretending I WANTED to be by myself...\nIt was all a lie.

When I got left behind and couldn't go to
the festival, I was lonely. And when I said
I'd go back to the Halidom without you,
I was lonely then, too.
I hated being alone all the time! In truth,\nI wanted to be together with someone.
You've had to endure more solitude than\nany girl your age ever should. It's okay\nnow. That part of your life is over.
Cleo... Thank you. But it's kind of funny.\nHow you and I were the same long ago.
No. It actually makes me feel better.\nI think... I might even be happy now.

To be together with someone who used to
hurt the same way I did... It makes it all
hurt so much less. I think I can keep on
going. And that's why...
I want to stick with you, Cleo, so we can\nsolve this whole mess once and for all.\nIs it...okay for me to hope for that?
Of course it is. We'll get this situation\nsorted out, just you wait!
*pant* *pant* *pant* This is bad.\nNyarlathotep is nowhere to be found!
Yeah... Where the heck did he go? If we\ndon't find him fast, something terrible is\ngoing to happen!
Southwest of here lies a town.\nNyarlathotep awaits you there.
You're the ghost who opened the\ngate for us!
So it was true after all...\nWho in the world are you?
I am a soul, called back here by the\nheretical ritual my wife undertook.
That must mean...\nYou're Banquo, aren't you?
Yes. All this time, I've been trying to get\nsomeone to stop my wife. To save her.
And to that end, you helped us.\nBut now your wife's body is...
Yes. But I know her soul is not yet gone.\nI want her back, even if she is no more\nthan a soul captured inside that thing.
If you follow the souls, you will find\nNyarlathotep. Please... I beg you to\ndefeat that monster once and for all.
Of course. We will go at once.
We will pluck out the evil that orchestrated\nthese events at the root, and bring back the\ncaptive soul of that woman!
